verses.verse: Next I heard a loud voice from the temple saying to the seven angels, "Go your ways and pour out the cups of God's fierce anger on the earth."
The first went and poured out his cup on the earth, and it caused a pernicious and terrible ulcer on those having the mark of the beast and worshiping his statue.
Then the second angel poured out his cup on the sea, and it became like the blood of a dead man. All living things in the sea died.
The third angel poured out his cup on the rivers and springs of water, and they turned into blood.
Then I heard the angel of the waters say, "You are righteous, O Lord, who are, were, and will be, because you have judged these things,
for they have poured out the blood of God's people and prophets, and you have given them blood to drink, because they deserve it."
I heard another from the altar say, "Truly so, Lord God Almighty; true and righteous [are] your judgments."
Then the fourth angel poured out his cup on the sun. It was given to it to scorch people with fire.
And people were scorched with intense heat and blasphemed the name of God, who has authority over these plagues, but they did not repent to give him glory.
The fifth angel poured out his cup on to the throne of the beast, and his kingdom was total darkness. They gnawed their tongues because of pain,
and blasphemed the God of heaven, because of their intense pain and ulcers, but they did not repent of their actions.
The sixth angel poured out his cup on the great river Euphrates, and its water was dried up, so that the way for the kings of the east might be prepared.
Then I saw three unclean spirits resembling frogs come out of the mouth of the dragon, the mouth of the beast, and the mouth of the false prophet.
For indeed, they are the spirits of devils, doing miracles, which go out to the kings of the earth and whole world to unite them for the battle of that great day of God Almighty.
"Pay attention, I come like a thief. Happy [is] he who is vigilant and keeps his clothes, lest he walk naked, and they see his shame."
And he united them in one place called in Hebrew, Armageddon.
The seventh angel poured out his cup into the air, and there came a loud voice from the temple of heaven, from the throne, saying, "It has happened."
Then there were voices, thunders, and lightnings, and there was immense earthquake such as never happened before--since people were on the earth, such a strong and immense earthquake.
The great city was split into three parts, and the cities of the nations collapsed. The great Babylon was remembered in the sight of God, to give to her the cup of the wine of his fierce anger.
Every island vanished, and the mountains were not found.
Next there fell huge hail from heaven on people, about the weight of a talent [about 100 pounds]. People blasphemed God because of the plague of hail, for this very plague was very great.
